li.text: Added more project properties. One new property is the "Use Shared Compiler" option. This will improve compilation speed, but may have a side effect that some compiler (parser) errors are not shown in details.
If you experience this, then please disable this option.
Added more properties to the Build System. All C# properties should now also be supported for X#, even though some of them are not visible in the property dialogs inside VS.
Added a CreateManifest task to the Build System so you will not get an error anymore for projects that contain managed resources
The performance of the editor should be better with this release.
Marking and unmarking text blocks as comment would not always be reflected in the editor colors. This has been fixed.
We have added a first version of the
preprocessor
. This preprocessor supports the #define command, #ifdef, #ifndef, #else, #endif, #include, #error and #warning. #command and #translate (to add user defined commands) are not supported yet.
The "
AS <Type>
" clause is now optional on most places. The
Core
dialect still does not support untyped code, but will now produce better error messages when you have forgotten to type your code.
We rolled the underlying Roslyn code forward to VS 2015 Update 1. Not that you see much of this from the outside <g>, but several fixes and enhancements have made their way into the compiler.
Added a
YIELD EXIT
statement (You can also use
YIELD BREAK).
Added an (optional)
OVERRIDE
keyword which can be used as modifier on virtual methods which are overridden in a subclass.
Added a
NOP
keyword

which you can use in code which is intentionally empty (for example the otherwise branch of a case statement. The compiler will no longer warn about an empty block when you insert a NOP keyword there.
The
On
and
Off
keywords could cause problems, because they were not positional (these are part of the pragma statement). This has been fixed.
_AND()
and
_OR()
expressions with one argument now throw a compiler error.
The compiler now recognizes the /VO14 (store literals as float) compiler switch (it has not been implemented yet).
Added a
operator as alias for the
(Exponent) operator.
Added an "unsupported" error when using the Minus operator on strings.
Fixed a "Stack overflow" error in the compiler that could occur for very long expressions.
The right shift operator no longer conflicts with two Greater Than operators, which allows you to declare or create generics without having to put a space between them.
var x := List<Tuple<int,int>>{}
Added and improved several project properties
Fix a problem with the "Additional Compiler Options"
Improved coloring in the editor for Keywords, Comments etc. You can set the colors from the Tools/Options dialog under General/Fonts & Colors. Look for the entries with the name "XSharp Keyword" etc.
Added Windows Forms Template
Several errors have been demoted to warnings to be more compatible with VO/Vulcan
Added support for Comment lines that start with an asterisk
Added support for the DEFINE statement. For now the DEFINE statement MUST have a type
DEFINE WM_USER := 0x0400 AS DWORD
Fixed problem with Single Line Properties with GET and SET reversed
Several fixes for Virtual and Non virtual methods in combination with the /VO3 compatibility option

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The "ns" (add default namespace to classes without namespace) has been implemented

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The "vo3" compiler option (to make all methods virtual ) has been implemented

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed an issue where the send operator on an expression between parentheses was not compiling properly

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Relational operators for strings (>, >=, <, <=) are now supported. They are implemented using the String.Compare() method.

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed a problem with local variables declared on the start line from FOR .. NEXT statements

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Added first version of the documentation in CHM & PDF format

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Added several properties to the Visual Studio Project properties dialog to allow setting the new compiler options

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed a problem in the Targets files used by MsBuild because some standard macros such as $(TargetPath) were not working properly

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:13px; line-height:1.05; page-break-inside:avoid; page-break-after:avoid;

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: XIDE 0.1.7 is included. This version of XIDE is completely compiled with XSharp !

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The name of some of the MsBuild support files have changed. This may lead to problems loading a VS project if you have used the VS support from the previous build. If that is the case then please edit the xsproj file inside Visual Studio and replace all references of "XSharpProject" with "XSharp" . Then safe the xsproj file and try to reload the project again

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The WHILE.. ENDDO (a DO WHILE without the leading DO) is now recognized properly

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: This version now comes with an installer

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: This version includes a first version of the Visual Studio Integration. You can edit, build, run and debug inside Visual Studio. There is no "intellisense" available.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The compiler now uses 1-based arrays and the “az” compiler option has been implemented to switch the compiler to use 0-based arrays.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The "vo2" compiler option (to initialize string variables with String.Empty) has been implemented

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Please note that there is no option in the VS project properties dialog yet for the az and vo2 compiler options. You can use the "additional compiler options" option to specify these compiler options.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The text "this" and "base" in error messages has been changed to "SELF" and "SUPER"

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Error of type “visibility” (for example public properties that expose private or internal types) have been changed to warnings

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed a problem with TRY … ENDTRY statements without CATCH clause

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The compiler now has a better resolution for functions that reside in other (X#) assemblies

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed a problem which could lead to an "ambiguous operator" message when mixing different numeric types.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: When an error occurs in the parsing stage, X# no longer enters the following stages of the compiler to prevent crashes. In addition to the errors from the parser also an error 9002 is displayed.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Parser errors now also include the source file name in the error message and have the same format as other error messages. Please note that we are not finished yet with handling these error messages. There will be improvements in the format of these error messages in the upcoming builds.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The compiler will display a “feature not available” (8022) error when a program uses one of the Xbase types (ARRAY, DATE, FLOAT, PSZ, SYMBOL, USUAL).

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed an error with VOSTRUCT and UNION types

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed a problem with the exclamation mark (!) NOT operator

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Several changes to allow calculations with integers and enums

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Several changes to allow VO compatible _OR, _AND, _NOT an _XOR operations

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fix interface/abstract VO properties

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Insert an implicit “USING System” only if not explicitly declared

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Error 542 turned to warning (members cannot have the same name as their enclosing type)

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Changes in the .XOR. expression definition

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fix double quote in CHAR_CONST lexer rule

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Allow namespace declaration in class/struct/etc. name (CLASS Foo.Bar)

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fix access/assign crash where identifier name was a (positional) keword: ACCESS Value

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Preprocessor keywords were not recognized after spaces, but only at the start of the line. This has been fixed.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Prevent property GET SET from being parsed as expression body

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fix default visibility for interface event

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Unsafe errors become warnings with /unsafe option, PTR is void*

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fix dim array field declaration

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Initial support of VO cast and VO Conversion rules (TYPE(_CAST, Expression) and TYPE(Expression)). _CAST is always unchecked (LONG(_CAST, dwValue)) and convert follows the checked/unchecked rules (LONG(dwValue))

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed problem with codeblock with empty parameter list

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed problems with GlobalAttributes.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: An AUTO property without GET SET now automatically adds a GET and SET block

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Allow implicit constant double-to-single conversion

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Change inconsistent field accessibility error to warning and other similar errors

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Added commandline support for Vulcan arguments. These arguments no longer result in an error message, but are not really implemented, unless an equivalent argument exists for the Roslyn (C#) compiler. For example: /ovf and /fovf are both mapped to /checked, /wx is mapped to /warnaserror. /w should not be used because that has a different meaning /warning level). /nowarn:nnnn should be used in stead

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fixed problem where the PUBLIC modifier was assigned to Interface Members or Destructors

li.text: Prevent expression statements from starting with CONSTRUCTOR() or DESTRUCTOR()

li.text: Added support for ? statement without parameters
